description.value:
As a Water Type Pokemon -

You gain a swim speed equal to your highest speed.

You do not take the usual –2 circumstance penalty to melee slashing or bludgeoning attacks that pass through water. When in an aquatic environment, you ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.

If Water is your only type, you also get the following -

When you swim you can perform a 1-action activity at any point during this movement without stopping (Such as a strike, Casting a 1-action spell or an Interact action to pick up an object). This still counts as two actions.

As a Psychic Type Pokemon -

You gain the following Reaction.
Meditate
[reaction] (fortune)
Trigger You’re about to attempt a check to Recall Knowledge;
Effect
You use a special technique that allows you to better organise your thoughts before speaking. You roll a second time and use the higher result. Then you cannot use this ability again for 1d4 turns.

If Psychic is your only type, you also get the following -

You gain Basic Telepathy. 

This allows you to communicate mentally with any creatures within 5 feet, as long as you both share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.
Starting Level 9, this Telepathy has a range of 30 feet instead.

You are a Pokemon with a Single Type, meaning you can select Ancestry Feats only from your Unique pokemon Ancestry or from this one Type's Ancestry Feat options.
However, you also gain your Type's Mono-Type Benefits.

If your GM is playing with Type-Matchup rulesets, you also have the weaknesses and resistances of that type.

You gather Aura into your palm, forming a concentrated ball of energy that rumbles loudly and warps space around it. Make a ranged spell attack roll against your target's AC. 

On a success, you deal 3d6 force damage.

On a critical success, the target takes double damage.
The number of actions you spend when casting this Spell determines the range and other parameters.

2 (One action)This spell instead deals 1d4 damage per spell level and has a range of 20 feet.

2 This spell has a range of 30 feet and deals damage as normal.

3 This spell has a range of 60 feet and deals half damage on a failure (but not a critical failure).

3 3 Two Rounds
If you spend 3 actions Casting the Spell, you can avoid finishing charging up and spend another 3 actions on your next turn to empower the spell even further. If you do, after attacking the target, whether you hit or miss, the energy ball explodes, dealing @Damage[(@item.rank*2)d6[force]] damage to all other creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] around the target (basic Reflex save).

After using this spell, your aura can be seen seeping through your body for 1 minute, dealing @Damage[(@item.rank)[force]] damage to creatures that hit you with a Touch-range spell or ability, an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee weapon.

Heightened (+1) The initial damage on a hit, as well as the burst damage for two-round casting time, each increase by 2d6, and the damage creatures take if they touch or hit you while you're in your Burning Aura state increases by 1.

As a Normal Type Pokemon -

You can attempt skill actions that normally require a character to be trained even if you're untrained, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the check when doing so.

As a Rock Type Pokemon -

You can ignore non-magical difficult terrain caused by rubble and uneven ground made of stone and earth. While climbing you can use both of your hands freely by firmly affixing yourself to the wall using your other limbs.
You also gain the Rock Sense action.
-Rock Sense
1 action 

Duration : Until the start of your next turn. 

You gain an imprecise tremorsense with a range of 30 feet.

This Tremorsense can be used in exploration mode while moving at half speed.

If Rock is your only type, you also get the following -

Your tremorsense is permanent, it is also considered precise at a range of 10 feet.

You do not move at half speed when using it in exploration mode.

In addition, if any effect would force you to move 10 feet or more, you are moved only half the distance.

Select this Ancestry if your Character is NOT included in the Pokefinder Exploration Society Homebrew by Default.

You may work with your GM to adapt an existing Ancestry or instead select an additional Level 1 Ancestry Feat that you qualify for from this module.

Frequency once per day

Either by melting the Magma back into your body or breaking it with hard stones, you temporarily destroy your Magma Shell and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for the next minute.
You can use the extra action each round only to perform Strikes or Movement actions.
You must spend 10 minutes to reform your shell.


Your Shell is considered to be destroyed as though you are not wearing armor, meaning its usual traits no longer affect you and it does not provide its AC bonuses.
However, any modification, new traits or property runes applied to your Magma Shell also function while naked, provided they could still function on Unarmored clothing.

After gaining this feat, you may start to wear armor by melting your shell back into your body but the benefits of your Shell and any property runes applied to it are Nullified until you remove this new armor and spend 10 minutes reforming your shell.

description.gm: Note : This version of Infernal Spirit Guide is for players that are already Ghost Type prior to taking this feat or who evolve into a Ghost Type.
description.value:
You gain Low-Light Vision (Darkvision, if you are already a Ghost Type) and Spiritsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.
You can target Ghosts or Undeads with strikes, spells and abilities that normally wouldn’t have any effects such as intimidating a mindless zombie or grappling an incorporeal creature. 

If you score a critical hit and deal damage to a single creature, you can choose to either gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level or inflict it with Persistent Fire Damage equal to your level. Both last for 1 minute or until the condition is lost, whichever comes first. 

(When you do so, you apply the effects of a normal Success rather than a critical success. You cannot gain temporary Hit Points from a normal type Pokemon or a Creature with no soul, such as a Construct.)

As an Ice Type Pokemon -

You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme 

(incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).

You ignore difficult terrain caused by snow and ice, treat greater difficult terrain created by snow and ice as difficult terrain, and leave no tracks when moving through areas of snow or ice.

Your body becomes covered in hardened metal called a Heavy Metal skin.

Your Heavy Metal skin is heavy armor and in the plate armor group, it has a +5 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of 1, a check penalty of –2, a Speed penalty of –5 feet, a Strength requirement of +3.

Your body can hold a single property rune; you can’t etch a property rune on your body if it has requirements on the type or category of armor or if the property would affect the armor instead of its wearer.

You cannot wear other armor or remove your Metal Hide, except to wear other heavy armor.

You cannot wear other armor or remove your Metal Hide, except to wear other heavy armor.

Heavy Metal skin is considered Heavy Armor but uses your highest armor proficiency.

Size : Small
[The Mouse-Mole Pokémon]

You gain a pair of Digger’s Claws as natural weapons that you can furiously swipe with. They deal 1d4 slashing damage and have the Razing, Agile, Finesse and Sweep traits.

When you are subjected to forced movement, you can curl up to make use of the momentum to roll or spin into a more advantageous position, you can step 5 feet for every 15 feet of forced movement you underwent as a free action.
This movement is also considered Forced movement.

As a Steel Type Pokemon -

You gain resistance to poison equal to half your level (minimum 1). You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vJZ83ehQiM906lea]{Detect Metal} cantrip as an innate spell at will.
A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.


If Steel is your only type, you also get the following -

You gain the Lock-On action.
Lock-On 

1-Action

Target : 1 Creature

Duration : Until the start of your next turn.

You take aim at the target, ensuring your next move does not miss.

The action you take on the target ignores concealment and lesser cover.

As a Fairy Type Pokemon -

You get a +1 bonus to your saving throws against Curse, Fortune and Misfortune effects.

As a Flying Type Pokemon -

You can float up to 3 feet above solid and liquid surfaces while moving at full speed.

This allows you to ignore difficult terrain and damaging effects related to coming into direct contact with the surface.

It typically allows you to also avoid triggering the reactions of hazards that require you to step on them or an attached pressure plate.

As a Fighting Type Pokemon -

You become trained in Acrobatics or Athletics and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.W6Gl9ePmItfDHji0] skill feat for that skill.

As a Bug Type Pokemon -

You must be within reach of 3 enemies to be considered flanked by creatures of your level or lower.

As an Electric Type Pokemon -

You gain a +1 status bonus to Reflex Saving Throws and you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kBhaPuzLUSwS6vVf] cantrip as an innate Spell.

As a Dark Type Pokemon -

You gain Darkvision.

Your Magma Shell is heavy armor in the Skeletal armor group that grant a +6 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of 0, a check penalty of –1, a Strength requirement of +2, and has the comfort, Hindering and Bulwark traits.

The Bulwark trait makes it so On Reflex saves to avoid a damaging effect, such as a fireball, you add a +3 modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier.

The Hindering trait makes you take a –5 penalty to all your Speeds (to a minimum of a 5-foot Speed) even if you meet the Strength requirements.

Your body can hold a single property rune; you can’t etch a property rune on your body if it has requirements on the type or category of armor or if the property would affect the armor instead of its wearer.


You cannot wear other armor or remove your shell, your Magma Shell is considered Heavy Armor but uses your highest armor proficiency.

description.gm: A Monk player should be able to use their abilities even while wearing this.
description.value:
Size : Small

Attribute Adjustment  ; +1 Con -1 Cha and 2 Free Ability Boosts

[The Lava Pokémon]

You gain the Steady Balance skill feat even if you don’t meet the prerequisites.

Any creature that hits you with an unarmed Strike or touch-range spell or ability takes 1d4 Fire damage. Your body is covered in hardened Magma which functions as armor.

Your Magma Shell is heavy armor in the Skeletal armor group that grant a +6 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of 0, a check penalty of –1, a Strength requirement of +2, and has the comfort, Hindering and Bulwark traits.

The Bulwark trait makes it so On Reflex saves to avoid a damaging effect, such as a fireball, you add a +3 modifier instead of your Dexterity modifier.

The Hindering trait makes you take a –5 penalty to all your Speeds (to a minimum of a 5-foot Speed) even if you meet the Strength requirements.

Your body can hold a single property rune; you can’t etch a property rune on your body if it has requirements on the type or category of armor or if the property would affect the armor instead of its wearer.


You cannot wear other armor or remove your shell, your Magma Shell is considered Heavy Armor but uses your highest armor proficiency.

As a Dragon Type Pokemon -

You either gain an imprecise sense of your choice with a range of 30 feet, or a precise sense of your choice with a range of 10 feet.


Work with your GM to choose this sense, if you are a Dual-type it should match your second type somewhat, such as Wavesense if you are Dragon-Water Type.

You may also choose to gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} Cantrip instead.

Attribute Adjustment ; 2 free attributes and  +1 Dex -1 Con

Size : Small(Cyndaquil), Medium(Quilava, Typhlosion)

The Volcano Pokémon

You have several Lava holes covering your body that you can use to vent out your body's flames, erupting wildly.
You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pokefinder-exploration-society-playable-pocket-creatures.pack-1.Item.s054N1Tvl9KkQKqr] reaction.

Attribute Adjustment ; 2 free attributes and  +1 Cha -1 Int

Size : Small

[The Metalsmith Pokémon]

You become trained in Crafting and gain the Specialty Crafting skill feat with Blacksmithing. You gain a unique Weapon that you have crafted using scrap metal called a Tinka-Tool. It can either be a level 0 common simple or martial weapon of your choice, or another level 0 simple or martial weapon to which you have access (Such as a Firearm if you are an Inventor or if your GM allows you access to such weapons).

You can instead use the statistics of a 1st-level common simple or martial weapon of your choice, or another 1st-level simple or martial weapon to which you have access to, but you must pay the monetary Price for the weapon. 

A Tinka-Tool can have fundamental and property runes added to it in the same way as an ordinary weapon. 

Because of the unique features of your weapon, everyone except you is untrained in it.

Should you lose or become separated from your Tinka-Tool, you can spend a week of downtime crafting another one whereupon any previous one disappears.

(At your GM’s discretion, the time period to craft another one may be shorter depending on the length of your adventure, becoming either “during your next morning preparations” or “after an hour has passed”)

As a Ghost Type Pokemon -
You gain Low-Light Vision and have the negative healing ability, which means you are harmed by positive energy and healed by negative energy.

description.gm:
Alternative version has been made if a player's highest prof is not Heavy armor.
(I believe Unarmored Prof is *always* equal to the highest prof but edit as needed)
description.value:
Your body becomes covered in hardened metal called a Heavy Metal skin.

Your Heavy Metal skin is heavy armor and in the plate armor group, it has a +5 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of 1, a check penalty of –2, a Speed penalty of –5 feet, a Strength requirement of +3.

Your body can hold a single property rune; you can’t etch a property rune on your body if it has requirements on the type or category of armor or if the property would affect the armor instead of its wearer.

You cannot wear other armor or remove your Metal Hide, except to wear other heavy armor.

You cannot wear other armor or remove your Metal Hide, except to wear other heavy armor.

Heavy Metal skin is considered Heavy Armor but uses your highest armor proficiency.

You are a Pokemon with two Types, meaning you can select Ancestry Feats from both of your types' choices but you do not get the Mono-Type Benefits.

If your GM is playing with Type-Matchup rulesets, you also have the weaknesses and resistances of both types.

As a Fire Type Pokemon -
You treat environmental heat effects as if they were one step less severe. 

(Incredible heat becomes extreme, extreme heat becomes severe, and so on)

You ignore difficult terrain caused by fire, treat greater difficult terrain created by fire and smoke as difficult terrain, and you do not suffocate while going through fire’s smoke.

As a Ground Type Pokemon -

You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Fortitude or Reflex DC against attempts to Shove or Trip you. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that attempt to knock you prone and other forms of forced movement.

You gain Low-Light Vision (Darkvision, if you are already a Ghost Type) and Spiritsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet.
You can target Ghosts or Undeads with strikes, spells and abilities that normally wouldn’t have any effects such as intimidating a mindless zombie or grappling an incorporeal creature. 

If you score a critical hit and deal damage to a single creature, you can choose to either gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level or inflict it with Persistent Fire Damage equal to your level. Both last for 1 minute or until the condition is lost, whichever comes first. 

(When you do so, you apply the effects of a normal Success rather than a critical success. You cannot gain temporary Hit Points from a normal type Pokemon or a Creature with no soul, such as a Construct.)

Size : Small(Riolu), Medium(Lucario)

Attribute Adjustment ; 2 free attributes and  +1 Cha, -1 Int

[The Aura Pokémon]

You become trained in Occultism and gain the Aura Sight skill feat for free. 

You gain Lifesense as a precise sense with a range of 10 feet but it also allows you to become aware of Willing allies that are within 500 feet that would otherwise be undetected by you.

You automatically succeed the flat check for you to target willing allies within 50 feet even if they would be concealed or hidden from you.

You are always aware of willing allies' present state, general direction and distance from you, and if they are conscious, unconscious, dying or dead.

Trigger You are the target of a strike or touch-range spell or ability and your attacker is within 5 feet.

Frequency Once per minute

Prerequisites You're part of the @UUID[Compendium.pokefinder-exploration-society-playable-pocket-creatures.pack-1.Item.fuPTCaU2NaFQ8HD9]{Cyndaquil evolutionary line}

Your attacker receives persistent fire damage equal to your level. Your attacker can stop their triggering action to reduce the damage by half.

description.gm:
Note for GMs : Spellcasting Proficiencies and Spell are not added automatically.

Please drag and drop the Aura Sphere spell onto their character sheet.
description.value:
You gain a Focus Pool of 1 point which you can recharge by meditating and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pokefinder-exploration-society-playable-pocket-creatures.pack-1.Item.8nb8SSQRN1k6SQTJ] focus spell as an occult spell.

This uses your highest spellcasting modifier that you have access to.

If you are not trained in any form of Spellcasting, it is considered Innate Spellcasting, meaning you become trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics.

At 12th level, these proficiencies increase to expert.
Charisma is your spellcasting attribute modifier for innate spells.

value.value: You are part of the Riolu-Lucario Evolutionary line

description.value:
As a Grass Type Pokemon -

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in natural terrain, and a +1 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction} in natural terrain. While in natural terrain, you're always considered to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Covering Tracks}, even if you chose a different activity in exploration mode.

As a Poison Type Pokemon -

You can detect if an object is poison or has been poisoned. 

If the poison’s level is higher than you, you do not ascertain whether the target is poisonous in multiple ways, nor do you learn the type or types of poison.

If the poison’s level is lower than you or equal, you learn the number and types of poison.

(Certain substances, like lead and alcohol, are poisons and so mask other poisons, see Detect Poison for further details) 

If Poison is your only type, you also get the following -

You get the Poison Stab action
-Poison Stab
1 action
Frequency Once per day
You apply poison to a weapon you are holding or one held by an adjacent willing creature. Until the end of your next turn, the next hit that deals damage with that weapon inflicts persistent poison damage equal to your level.

Size : Small(Venipede), Medium(Whirlipede), Large(Scolipede)

[The Centipede Pokémon]

You gain a Venomous Horns unarmed attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage, they are in the brawling group and have the unarmed and Versatile(Poison) traits.

Though they count as a single weapon, they are surprisingly flexible and can perform actions requiring a free hand, even if both of your hands are otherwise occupied.

Your Venomous Horns can’t perform actions that require fingers or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, and you can’t use it to hold items.

They can, however, be used to cast spells that require hand movements while your hands are occupied and they can deliver touch-range spells and other abilities.

Your body becomes covered in hardened metal called a Heavy Metal skin.

Your Heavy Metal skin is heavy armor and in the plate armor group, it has a +5 item bonus to AC, a Dex cap of 1, a check penalty of –2, a Speed penalty of –5 feet, a Strength requirement of +3.

Your body can hold a single property rune; you can’t etch a property rune on your body if it has requirements on the type or category of armor or if the property would affect the armor instead of its wearer.

You cannot wear other armor or remove your Metal Hide, except to wear other heavy armor.

You cannot wear other armor or remove your Metal Hide, except to wear other heavy armor.

Heavy Metal skin is considered Heavy Armor but uses your highest armor proficiency.
